pr_title: DB-10194 Create new database through JDBC connect

timeline.message: DB-10194 Create new database with correct uuid. New schemas use that uuid
DB-10194 Use placeholders in database authorizationId
DB-10194 Use sysvw instead of sys in 'show databases'

timeline.bodyText: this call is not assign to any variable, usually paramType. Looks like not needed any more and can be removed.
timeline.author: ipraznik-splice

replies.bodyText: (spotbug) I would leave this like this since getColumnType can throw. We never used paramType, but if we want to keep the current behaviour, then we should continue calling this function.
replies.author: arnaud-splice

timeline.bodyText: this call is not assign to any variable
timeline.author: ipraznik-splice

replies.bodyText: (spotbug) It simply moves the parser forward. We don't do anything with the result.
replies.author: arnaud-splice

timeline.bodyText: is it used somewhere in subclasses? in EmbedConnection I see only .set and .remove
timeline.author: ipraznik-splice

replies.bodyText:
It is used in SpliceDatabase.bootStore
It is quite similar to EngineLifecycleService.isCreate that we use when creating the very first splicedb. However, when we create a new database, we don't go all the way to EngineLifecycleService.start() so we cannot use that one class variable.
replies.author: arnaud-splice

timeline.author: ipraznik-splice

replies.bodyText: This will be addressed in the following jiras
replies.author: arnaud-splice
